alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 28 at 10:16PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Lamar and Marion. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1016 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hamilton, Haleyville, Sulligent, Guin, Hackleburg, Brilliant, Detroit, Beaverton, Gu-Win, Weston, Brinn, Crews, Lake Buttahatchee, Lamar County Airport, Bedford, Bear Creek, Twin, Rankin Fite Airport, Marion County Public Lake and Pikeville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
